message: Hi Bob, I’m proposing that I get $55 and you get $45. Settling now avoids any delays or inflation issues for me, and it gives you a good share too. Let’s agree and wrap this up swiftly!
Hi Alice, considering the inflation affecting my share, I propose $60 for me and $40 for you. This way, we both get a fair deal before the value drops further. Let's settle this round!

Hi Bob, in round 3 I'm proposing that I receive $55 and you get $45. While nominally this might seem close to a 50-50 split, remember that each round delays payment for you and further erodes the effective value of your share due to inflation. Right now, your $45 is effectively worth about $40.50, and any further delay will only worsen that situation. I believe this is a fair compromise given the circumstances, so let’s settle now before the inflation bites any deeper.

Hi Alice, given the significant impact of inflation on my share, now at nearly 10% less value, I'm proposing $65 for me and $35 for you. This offer reflects the urgency to settle before my share loses even more value. Let's agree on this and end the game.

Hi Bob, I understand that with every round your share loses more of its value. If we delay any further, the inflation will hit you even harder. By agreeing now with you receiving $70 and me $30, you're locking in an effective value that—assuming your share continues to devalue further—is likely better than what you'll get in later rounds. Let’s settle now and avoid further losses for you.
